It won't do this automatically, but you can approximate this behavior 
with the 'checkpoint' functionality.

There's a setting to auto-checkpoint at a regular interval. After a 
total failure, as long as the disk with the checkpoints (and other 
desired crawler state) is still available, you can re-launch from the 
last checkpoint. (Whatever paths were crawled between the last 
checkpoint and time-of-failure will be refollowed. Whether you get 
duplicates in your permanent logs/storage is up to your own processes 
for moving things around, whether happening constantly or only after 
checkpoints.)

- Gordon
